text:
Hi All,
I have created few custom modules and trying to create a separate module combining all those custom modules which are already created.
But unfortunately it's not available that I can add them as a field also copying snippet of those modules are throwing error.
Can anyone say whether this can be achievable yet in HubSpot or not ?

Thanks in Advance,
Mohesh Borah
You cannot make a custom module that contains other custom modules.
I was wondering if anyone had any hubl code examples to return if a visitor has the HubSpot UTK cookie: HubSpotutk, what would be the syntax for returning that
Finally just implemented this and it worked like charm! Thanks again.
Hi all, twig offers us a {% spaceless %}  tag which allows me to create readable macro’s that do not output the whitespace and breaks I have in my code. Does HubL offer something similar?
<@UGDF9EBPW> did you add a “-” such as this {% macro your_macro() *-*%}

Banging my head agains the wall on this.  Trying to grab the id of a multilanguage version of a blog but can’t seem to access it.  Here’s my variable: `{% set test = blog_by_id('111111111').translations.items() %}` which returns this: [es=2222222222, language: es, masterId: 1111111111] … so I think i’d be able to access the id like this: `{{ blog_by_id('11111111').<http://translations.es|translations.es> }}` but it returns nothing.
<@U0189NXRP1U> I did not, is that the fix? Will try tomorrow.

should work. from the docs … If your macro is returning whitespace in the form of new lines, you can strip whitespace in templates by hand. If you add a minus sign (`-`) to the start or end of a block, a comment, or a variable expression, the whitespaces before or after that block will be removed.  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables-macros-syntax>
Awesome, thank you for the info!
